pcts 0.14.0
  • Reference

Generate a periodic autoregression model

sim_parCoef.Rd

Generate a periodic autoregression model, possibly integrated.

sim_parCoef(period, n.root, sigma2 = rep(1, period), ...)

Arguments

period

number of seasons in a cycle.
n.root

number of non-zero roots, see details.
sigma2

variances of the innovations.
...

additional arguments to be passed down to sim_pcfilter

Details

sim_parCoef uses the multi-companion method to generate the model. The function is essentially a wrapper for sim_pcfilter.

The order of the filter is set to n.root for each season. Part of the spectral information may be specified with the "..." arguments, see sim_pcfilter and sim_mc for a discussion of this.

Value

a periodic autoregression model as a list with elements:

ar

a matrix whose \(i\)th row contains the coefficients for the \(i\)season,

sigma2

the innovation variances, a numeric vector.

References

Boshnakov GN and Iqelan BM (2009). ``Generation of time series models with given spectral properties.'' J. Time Series Anal., 30(3), pp. 349--368. ISSN 0143-9782, http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/j.1467-9892.2009.00617.x.

See also

sim_pcfilter

Examples

sim_parCoef(2, 4)                    # 2 seasons
#> $ar
#>      [,1]       [,2]       [,3]        [,4]       [,5]
#> [1,]    1  0.5002379 0.09265675 -0.03937456 0.04034384
#> [2,]    1 -9.0785653 3.59955632 -1.57640863 0.13582877
#> 
#> $sigma2
#> [1] 1 1
#> 
sim_parCoef(2, 4, sigma2 = c(2, 4))
#> $ar
#>      [,1]      [,2]         [,3]         [,4]         [,5]
#> [1,]    1 2.9692929 -2.557162298 -0.021157920 5.512654e-03
#> [2,]    1 0.8662499  0.004132551 -0.001517222 3.408861e-06
#> 
#> $sigma2
#> [1] 2 4
#> 
sim_parCoef(2, 1)
#> $ar
#>      [,1]       [,2]
#> [1,]    1  0.5214474
#> [2,]    1 -1.3778799
#> 
#> $sigma2
#> [1] 1 1
#> 
sim_parCoef(4, 2)                    # 4 seasons
#> $ar
#>      [,1]         [,2]       [,3]
#> [1,]    1 -0.625740112  0.4061333
#> [2,]    1 -0.007183413 -1.1564774
#> [3,]    1  0.095543698  2.2186685
#> [4,]    1  0.091861073 -0.5429412
#> 
#> $sigma2
#> [1] 1 1 1 1
#> 

sim_parCoef(period = 4, n.root = 6,
    eigabs = c(1, 1, 1, 0.036568887, 0.001968887),
    type.eigval = c("cp", "r", "r", "r",  "r"),
    eigsign     = c(pi/2,   1,  -1,   1,   -1))
#> $ar
#>      [,1]      [,2]       [,3]       [,4]       [,5]       [,6]          [,7]
#> [1,]    1 -9.110478  9.8941793 11.4100389  4.6759752  8.3270447 -1.027937e+01
#> [2,]    1  1.875398 -1.0781748  1.1620284 -0.2388985  0.3419781 -8.190616e-02
#> [3,]    1  3.977915 -3.8344288  0.7107512 -1.0401548 -0.1639952  3.246514e-01
#> [4,]    1  1.247974  0.4016551  1.4125584  0.5966581 -0.7337030  2.634099e-04
#> 
#> $sigma2
#> [1] 1 1 1 1
#>
